functionalities are implemented. For now the token used to buy items is Usdt but later we will Need to Add some whitelists of tokens We will also have to add Functions to updates constants and addresses For now the Tom token price is pegged to 1/10 of USD. Later on, we will implement an oracle + liquidity pool on some DEX","kind":"dev","methods":{"buyTOM(uint256)":{"details":"Approve function needs to run first For now 1 USDT = 10 TOM"},"cancelListing(uint256)":{"details":"Can only be run by seller or contract Owner. We also need to automate the canceling of sold out items using chainlink keepers maybe."},"claimRewards()":{"details":"after claiming, the spent amount is fixed to 0 again."},"getSpentAmount(address)":{"details":"both parties get 50 TOM"},"listItem(string,string,string,uint256,uint256,uint8,address,uint256)":{"details":"Approve function needs to run first The Posting FEE = 10% of sell price"},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."}},"title":"The Marketplace contract","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"buyTOM(uint256)":{"notice":"Function to purchase TOM token."},"cancelListing(uint256)":{"notice":"Cancel a listing"},"cancelOrder(uint256)":{"notice":"The buyer can cancel the order at any moment before the seller confirms the delivery on his part (which means that the item was not sent yet)."},"claimRewards()":{"notice":"Claims rewards if amount spent > 500 dollars"},"confirmDelivery(uint256)":{"notice":"After the sellers confirmation. the buyer checks that his item is received then confirms the delivery. The funds are unlocked to the seller"},"deliverySent(uint256)":{"notice":"First step after the buyer orders an item, The seller confirms the delivery on his part right before (or at the same time) of sending the item. He must confirm this state just as he is sending the item to lock the state and prevent the buyer from cancelling the order."},"getSpentAmount(address)":{"notice":"Register using a referal"},"initiateDispute(uint256)":{"notice":"After seller confirmation, either the buyer or seller can initiate a dispute if they think that either party has not fullfilled their engagement. The buyer will initiate the dispute if he argues that the seller did not send the product The seller will initiate the dispute if the product is correctly sent and received but the buyer refuses to confirm the transaction and unlock the funds."},"listItem(string,string,string,uint256,uint256,uint8,address,uint256)":{"notice":"List an item in the marketplace"},"orderCart(uint256[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Realistically, there is no overflow in i because a user will never be able to buy > MAX(UINT256) number of items"},"resolveDispute(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"A trusted arbiter will negotiate between both parties, then decides which party will receive the funds. The negociation have to be done in web2. The arbiter receives a fee on every dispute."}},"notice":"the Marketplace is where the logic for reward/fee transfers are buyTOM(uint256).details: Approve function needs to run first For now 1 USDT = 10 TOM

cancelListing(uint256).details: Can only be run by seller or contract Owner. We also need to automate the canceling of sold out items using chainlink keepers maybe.

claimRewards().details: after claiming, the spent amount is fixed to 0 again.

listItem(string,string,string,uint256,ui.details: Approve function needs to run first The Posting FEE = 10% of sell price

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

cancelOrder(uint256).notice: The buyer can cancel the order at any moment before the seller confirms the delivery on his part (which means that the item was not sent yet).

claimRewards().notice: Claims rewards if amount spent > 500 dollars

confirmDelivery(uint256).notice: After the sellers confirmation. the buyer checks that his item is received then confirms the delivery. The funds are unlocked to the seller

deliverySent(uint256).notice: First step after the buyer orders an item, The seller confirms the delivery on his part right before (or at the same time) of sending the item. He must confirm this state just as he is sending the item to lock the state and prevent the buyer from cancelling the order.

initiateDispute(uint256).notice: After seller confirmation, either the buyer or seller can initiate a dispute if they think that either party has not fullfilled their engagement. The buyer will initiate the dispute if he argues that the seller did not send the product The seller will initiate the dispute if the product is correctly sent and received but the buyer refuses to confirm the transaction and unlock the funds.

listItem(string,string,string,uint256,ui.notice: List an item in the marketplace

orderCart(uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Realistically, there is no overflow in i because a user will never be able to buy > MAX(UINT256) number of items

resolveDispute(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: A trusted arbiter will negotiate between both parties, then decides which party will receive the funds. The negociation have to be done in web2. The arbiter receives a fee on every dispute.

documentation.text: @dev Throws if called by any account other than arbiter.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Counters.Counter storage pointer) view returns (uint256)
literal_string "New price must be more than half of the old price"

arguments.value: New price must be more than half of the old price

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "New price must be more than half of the old price"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Caller must be Seller or Owner"

arguments.value: Caller must be Seller or Owner

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Caller must be Seller or Owner"

documentation.text: Realistically, there is no overflow in i because a user will never be able to buy > MAX(UINT256) number of items

First step after the buyer orders an item, The seller confirms the delivery on his part right before (or at the same time) of sending the item.
 He must confirm this state just as he is sending the item to lock the state and prevent the buyer from cancelling the order.
After the sellers confirmation. the buyer checks that his item is received then confirms the delivery. The funds are unlocked to the seller

After seller confirmation, either the buyer or seller can initiate a dispute if they think that either party has not fullfilled their engagement.
 The buyer will initiate the dispute if he argues that the seller did not send the product
 The seller will initiate the dispute if the product is correctly sent and received but the buyer refuses to confirm the transaction and unlock the funds.

A trusted arbiter will negotiate between both parties, then decides which party will receive the funds. The negociation have to be done in web2.
 The arbiter receives a fee on every dispute.
The buyer can cancel the order at any moment before the seller confirms the delivery on his part (which means that the item was not sent yet).

@notice Claims rewards if amount spent > 500 dollars
 @dev after claiming, the spent amount is fixed to 0 again.

@notice Register using a referal
 @dev both parties get 50 TOM
